title: [FEATURE] ability to disable libjpeg-turbo's do_fancy_upsampling and do_block_smoothing settings
body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem?

we have a legacy pixel-based fingerprinting routine that we are trying to port from net48 to dotnet5.

apparently yuv420 jpegs decoded with System.Drawing.Imaging don't have fancy upsampling or block smoothing applied, so after migrating to SkiaSharp we're encountering tiny differences that cause our fingerprints to fail.

### Describe the solution you would like

it seems like the upsampling and smoothing is implemented in libjpeg-turbo and disabled via [these flags](https://github.com/libjpeg-turbo/libjpeg-turbo/blob/9ddcae4a8f4aaa096ccdcddec36afc52fbc01481/jpeglib.h#L548-L549), can we have corresponding SkCodecOptions to set them?



### Describe alternatives you have considered

the workaround is to use an alternative jpeg codec or call into libjpeg-turbo directly.
